Message: Last week, the attack on the US Capitol stunned many with its brazen assault on democracy. We, as many, were angered by the clear imbalance of treatment of those storming the Capitol grounds compared to the treatment of BIPOC by law enforcement on a daily basis, most recently to supporters at Black Lives Matter protests. The events that took place were powered by white supremacy and systemic racism, and those who incited and participated in the riots must be held accountable. We have joined Civic Alliance and hundreds of businesses to call for an orderly and peaceful transition of power affirming the will of the voters and ensuring that President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris are inaugurated at noon on January 20, 2021. As a business and community, we are in support of any efforts to minimize the negative impact of the current administration. At Lush, we stand for and with those who continue the pressure for transformative systemic change. Creating lasting change will take hard work, but together we can. Head to our Instagram stories to meet and support four frontline organizations leading the call for justice and equality for all. #capitolriots #capitolbuilding #peaceful #peace #BLM #inauguration

Message: STATEMENT ON PASSING OF US CAPITOL POLICE, NJ NATIONAL GUARD STAFF SGT BRIAN D. SICKNICK, 41, OF SOUTH RIVER, NJ from Governor Phil Murphy “United States Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick embodied the selfless spirit of his native state. Officer Sicknick was a product of South River and a graduate of the Middlesex County Vocational and Technical Schools. Before joining the Capitol Police, he was Staff Sergeant Sicknick with the New Jersey Air National Guard. He was a Fire Team Member and Leader with the 108th Security Force Squadron, 108th Wing, at Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst, and his six years of service included overseas deployments in support of Operation Southern Watch and Operation Enduring Freedom. Tammy and I send our deepest condolences to Officer Sicknick’s family and friends, as well as to his United States Capitol Police colleagues and the Guardsmen and Guardswomen he served alongside. We thank him for his service to our nation. Officer Sicknick gave his life protecting the United States Capitol, and by extension, our very democracy, from violent insurrection. His needless murder at the hands of a mob bent on overthrowing the Constitution he had dedicated his life to upholding is shocking. It is my fervent hope that the rioters whose actions directly contributed to his death are quickly identified and brought to justice.” #NewJersey #NJNationalGuard #CapitolRiots #CapitolPolice #LawAndOrder #BackTheBlue

Message: Time to Heal?: Trump Supporters, the GOP, and the Push for No Accountability Working with those who are involved in the justice system because of making problematic decisions, there is this understanding that exploring the reasons for decisions and making the conscious choice to make different ones in the future is a part of the treatment process. This does not negate the fact that many with whom I work or have worked are dealing in systems that disproportionately sentence/incarcerate BIPOC or over-police their communities Yet, n this work, it may not be society, but instead their individual communities, family, and friends to whom they must verbalize accountability. And in this, there is an understanding that Forgiveness may be sought, but it is not promised to you Remorse does not mean no consequences will happen or that one gets to choose them when they do Because in making decisions that cause harm to others, one’s choice in how that harm will be perceived or the expectation for responses to it, are left to those who are hurt In previous posts, I have talked about how the world often pressures those who are harmed to “move beyond” the hurt---even without acknowledgement of the harm or a plan to rectify it being developed. Within the past week, the world watched as the normalization of white supremacist beliefs, xenophobia, homophobia, etc that were championed by the United States’ President over the past 5 years, culminated in what many marginalized communities predicted Because we are not “new to this” oppression or violence aimed at our humanity But that surprised many within the White community There was a clear willingness to bring violence to the Nation’s Capitol with the goal of upholding white supremacy because voter suppression attempts did not work Those who had previously viewed racism and xenophobia as at a minimum “not a dealbreaker” and moreso as being points of pride Utilized the same White Privilege that they denied having, to storm the Capitol. Yet, when the fallout came, the excuses from these same groups were “We didn’t mean it” “I wasn’t thinking” And the push began for “healing” without accountability Note: Expecting Accountability is Self-Preservation and Self-Care. Too often, those harmed are gaslit with the idea of “healing” or “coming together” Because this serves those who have caused harm and know that the Healing Narrative will minimize the insistence on justice Healing does not happen without work being done Healing does not negate that consequences are necessary Healing needs to include justice As a psychologist, do I recognize the emotional benefits of healing?---absolutely And at the same time, it is at the behest of the Harmed when this can and should occur, and what it needs to look like In this instance, those who were willing to enact violence at the Heart of what is (although moreso a “work in need of progress”) American Democracy Are not the people who get to determine or demand this happen So, let the healing begin..... When those who are marginalized/oppressed deem it so #CapitolRiots #Impeachment #Healing #DrTyffani #BlackLivesMatter Dr. Dent is a licensed psychologist. Her hardest job is being a Black Woman who centers the experiences of Black women and girls. She recognizes America for what it is and her Healing Journey requires justice be served.

Message: American friends! You're probably shocked by what the USA has turned into. As your friend, let me tell you how the situation looks from the outside: https://againstthetide.tv/2021/01/10/how-americans-can-regain-their-homeland-whats-next-after-capitol-storming:=:https://againstthetide.tv/2021/01/10/how-americans-can-regain-their-homeland-whats-next-after-capitol-storming/ PastorPaweł Chojecki, New Covenant Church in Lublin, Poland, editor-in-chief Against the Tide TV #CapitolRiots #January6 #AntifaCapitol Dear American friends! I can imagine you are shocked by what America has turned into that last year. As a great friend of yours who has often used America as an example for the whole world, let me tell you how your situation looks from the outside. In my sermons, I often asked why the American Constitution is so short. The answer to that question is fundamental to understanding what is happening today. Your Constitution does not stand on its own but is inextricably based on the Bible. It is only together that they served as a signpost for your ancestors. The American Constitution can only function properly in a Christian society. In other words, America’s prosperity and power and justice grew when there was a good number of men and women in your Nation who personally trusted in the redemption Jesus Christ brought to us through His blood, shed on the Cross of Golgotha, and who lived a life devoted to Him. In 2016, after Donald Trump’s victory, I asked the question: “A NEW ERA OF THE CHURCH OR THE HOME STRETCH?” After visiting your wonderful country and many biblical churches in 2018, I returned with very sad thoughts. I then delivered four sermons for you. The series was entitled “How to drive the Communists out of churches?” I would very much like to see American patriots finally learning the truth that this great crisis that we are facing today is not due to the power of communists and globalists but to the weaknesses of American Christians and churches. The belief that America will always be Christian and never be socialist proved that Americans placed their hope in man and not in Almighty God. The world is not over yet. Jesus wants all of His disciples to draw the right conclusions from the tragedy that has occurred over the recent months. Do not be fooled by those who call for an escalation of violence, secession, or purely political solutions. America was a City on the Hill for one reason only: “In God We Trust”! Now, there is a simple way for you to change the fate of your homeland and thus, of the whole world. American Christians must return to their deep devotion to Jesus Christ and reject the worldly way of life described in the letter to the Church in Laodicea in Revelation 3:14–22. You must once again reach for the profound wisdom of the Word of God. Pray for your eyes to be opened to it. Kindle afresh the enthusiasm for the evangelization of your countrymen and the whole world. You need churches that are strong in Christ, so focus on godly pastors who reject the deceptive theology of success. After all, it was the representatives of this kind of theology who tried to deceive you with a vision, supposedly revealed to them from heaven, that Trump would triumph in the 2020 election. Christ’s Church is strong only when it consists of Jesus’ humble disciples, who recognize their weakness and who are great by His strength and His power. This is the simple key to rebuilding and winning! It is going to be a long and difficult road, but it is the only one you can take. As Polish evangelical Christians, we will pray for you, provide support, and strive to be an encouragement and inspiration to you. Remember, it is not a battle for America only. It is a war for the whole world. Paweł Chojecki, pastor of the New Covenant Church in Lublin, editor-in-chief of Against the Tide TV

Message: Don't know about you, but I'm pretty sure I saw "that b*tch" Carole Baskin inside at the #CapitolRiots yesterday!

This morning I had the unique honor of holding my husband’s left hand as he raised his right and took an oath to uphold the Constitution of the United States of America and the State of Colorado. I beamed with pride as he repeated the solemn vow in front of a District Court Judge and fellow attorneys of his office. I witness his commitment to that oath firsthand each and every day. It shapes how we live, parent, and love. The significance of this past week’s events were not lost upon me as we stood in the courthouse where we first met. Words have failed me to this point. I am sure they have for many in trying to describe the feelings we have towards witnessing our Nation’s Capitol building and Democracy under siege. The political, racial, gender, and socio-economic division in this country was plainly illustrated for anyone who hadn’t already been paying attention. Yet, in a time where the privileged are being forced to confront the underlying inequalities that so many fellow Americans face, I stood with a man who has fought tirelessly for the victims and citizens of this great state for the past 24 years. And knowing that together, we’ll be fighting for what’s right makes me hopeful. This country is not beyond repair. But if we want to grow beyond this dark chapter, we have to hold space for authentic conversations and demand accountability of our elected officials. It requires justice--doing the right thing, in the right way, for the right reasons. Equal application of the law is the antithesis of hypocrisy. And today I was honored to share this event with my hero. A man I have watched live and breathe this sacred oath day in and day out. Forward 8/1 skriver: "Fact Check: The ‘6 Million Wasn’t Enough’ shirt wasn’t from the Capitol siege. The shirt is an antisemitic slogan, as reported. But the widely-circulated photo isn't from Wednesday's riot at the Capitol, but an earlier gathering of the Proud Boys in D.C. On a Jan. 7 episode of MSNBC’s “The Last Word with Lawrence O’Donnell,” the anchor condemned some of the antisemitic fashion choices seen on the National Mall the day rioters stormed the Capitol, including the infamous “Camp Auschwitz” hoodie. But one of the images he used, and that was widely shared on Twitter, was not from that day. The ADL wrote the photo was taken at an earlier gathering of Proud Boys in Washington, D.C., and previously disseminated on social media. The image popped up again on Twitter in the aftermath of the Capitol siege on the Twitter feed of writer Roya Hakakian."

from Governor Phil Murphy
 “United States Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick embodied the selfless spirit of his native state. Tammy and I send our deepest condolences to Officer Sicknick’s family and friends, as well as to his United States Capitol Police colleagues and the Guardsmen and Guardswomen he served alongside. We thank him for his service to our nation.  

Officer Sicknick gave his life protecting the United States Capitol, and by extension, our very democracy, from violent insurrection. His needless murder at the hands of a mob bent on overthrowing the Constitution he had dedicated his life to upholding is shocking. It is my fervent hope that the rioters whose actions directly contributed to his death are quickly identified and brought to justice.”

Message: Federal Prosecutor Opens Excessive Force Investigation Into Death Of Ashli Babbitt: Report Authored by Samuel Allegri via The Epoch Times (emphasis ours) Michael Sherwin, acting U.S. attorney for the District of Columbia, said that his office has started a federal, excessive force investigation over the shooting and killing of former U.S. Air Force veteran Ashli Babbitt in the Capitol on Jan. 6. Sherwin confirmed the investigation with CBS News. His civil rights section will lead the prosecution, which is being investigated by D.C. police and the FBI. The Epoch Times hasn’t been able to independently verify the investigation. The U.S. Attorney Office of the District of Columbia refused to comment on the reported investigation. The FBI and The U.S. Capitol Police (USCP) didn’t respond to a request for comment. #CapitolRiots NEW: US Attorney Michael Sherwin confirms @CBSNews his office has opened a formal, federal excessive force investigation related to the shooting death of Ashli Babbitt who was shot by US Capitol Police Wednesday within the Capitol building. Sherwin has assigned — Catherine Herridge (@CBS_Herridge) January 9, 2021 On Jan. 6, Trump supporters marched on foot to the Capitol after President Donald Trump gave a speech near the White House. Trump thanked his supporters for being present and listed a series of voting irregularities that happened in different states, alleging there was widespread fraud. Rudy Giuliani, the president’s attorney, also gave a speech listing evidence for the alleged fraud. Babbitt entered the Capitol building with a group of protesters, including left-wing activist John Sullivan. A man in a widely circulated video of the shooting of U.S. Air Force veteran Ashli Babbitt, 28-year-old Thomas Baranyi, later gave a recount of what happened. A reporter from CBS affiliate WKRG interviewed him after he stormed the Capitol with protestors and Ashli Babbitt. “We had stormed into the chambers inside and there was a young lady who rushed to the windows,” Baranyi said “A number of police and Secret Service were saying ‘get back, get down, get out of the way.’ She didn’t heed the call.” He said that he tried to pull her back when she got fatally shot. “And as we kind of raced up to grab people and pull them back, they shot her in the neck, and she fell back on me and started to say she was fine. It’s cool. And then she started moving weird and blood was coming out of her mouth and neck and nose,” Baranyi said. “Just make sure people know, because this cannot stand anymore. This is wrong. They don’t represent anyone. Not Republican, Democrat, Independent, nobody. And now they’ll just, they’ll kill people,” Baranyi added. Tony Mazziott, Babbitt’s grandfather, told ABC News’ “Good Morning America” that she was an “excellent patriot” and a “loving person.” “She served time in the military and she’s passionate about everything, particularly Donald Trump for some reason,” he said. Family members said Babbitt served more than a decade in the Air Force. Message: Major companies have begun suspending donations to Republicans involved in in the Biden certification challenge. In the wake of the U.S. Capitol attacks, 3 major corporations said they are suspending contributions through their corporate PACs to Republican lawmakers they’ve previously backed: 1 - Hotel giant Marriott International 2 - Health insurance network Blue Cross Blue Shield 3 - Bank holding company Commerce Bancshares. All have stated that they will stop donating to any Congress member who objected to the certification of the Electoral College vote. In addition to the vows to indefinitely suspend donations, the following corporations have said they will take recent events into consideration before making future donations: 1 - Bank of America 2 - Ford Motor Co. 3 - AT&T The following corporations have stated that they are currently reviewing their political giving: 1 - CVS Health Corp. 2 - Exxon Mobil 3 - FexEx 4 - Target #bigcorporations #majorconpanies #fundingsuspension #capitolriots #capitolhill
Link Text: Major Companies Begin Suspending Donations To Republicans Involved In Biden Certification Challenge
Description: Marriot International, Blue Cross Blue Shield and Commerce Bancshares have all said they will no longer support GOP members involved in challenging Biden's win after the Capitol riots.

Message: As of today, The House has impeached President Trump for inciting a violent insurrection against the United States government, as 10 members of the president’s party joined Democrats to charge him with high crimes and misdemeanors for an unprecedented second time. Reconvening under the threat of continued violence and the protection of thousands of National Guard troops, the House was determined to hold Mr. Trump to account just one week before he was to leave office. At issue was his role in encouraging a mob that attacked the Capitol one week ago while Congress met to affirm President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s victory, forcing lawmakers to flee for their lives in a deadly rampage. The House adopted a single article of impeachment, voting 232 to 197 to charge Mr. Trump with “inciting violence against the government of the United States” and requesting his immediate removal from office and disqualification from ever holding one again. Ten Republicans joined Democrats in voting to impeach: Representatives Liz Cheney of Wyoming, the party’s No. 3 leader in the House; Jaime Herrera Beutler of Washington; John Katko of New York: Adam Kinzinger of Illinois; Fred Upton of Michigan; Dan Newhouse of Washington: Peter Meijer of Michigan; Anthony Gonzalez of Ohio; David Valadao of California and Tom Rice of South Carolina. The defections were a remarkable break from the head of the party by Republicans, who voted unanimously against impeaching Mr. Trump just over a year ago. Courtesy of The New York Times. #blackhistorymonth #blackhistory #blackhistory365 #blackhistoryfacts #endgame #BlackLove #georgefloyd #blackwallstreet #NipseyHussle #negus #AMERICANDOS #blackmoney #blackmoneymatters #ticktock #telleveryoneracismkills #blacklivesmatter #SoundsOfBlackness #capitolriots #impeachment

I took this video down soon after posting it because Trump supporters were sending me threatening messages. However, if there was any time to repost the blocking of the Trump caravan in Waimanalo by Kanaka Maoli it's now. For four years Trump's rhetoric engendered violence against blacks, immigrants, muslims, women, LGBTQ, and people of color throughout the US and on January 6, 2021 it all came to a head at the Capitol when it all turned on the elected leaders of the US. On September 20, 2020 a few Kanaka Maoli stood in solidarity with other oppressed people against Trump's facist reign whose words, actions, and inaction is reminiscent of the early decades of the US occupation in Hawai'i when a white male oligarchy ruled this place. We must always stand for what is right and speak the truth which in the end always reveals itself. #BlackLivesMatter #KanakaBlockTrumpCaravan #CapitolRiots

Description:
There was a common response by Trump supporters in the videos that surfaced, showing them booted off airplanes and arrested in airports - shock, confusion, and dismay. 

“They kicked me off a plane, called me a [explicative] terrorist, and want to [explicative] ruin my life,” one passenger exclaimed in tears in the middle of an airport. 

It’s baffling how one thinks they can storm into the United States Capitol with a mob that bashes a federal police officer’s head in with a fire extinguisher, busts through windows and doors, calls for the execution of the Vice President, steals sensitive equipment, and expects to walk away without consequences. 

Perhaps the most revealing of the MAGA responses occurred when police wrestled one man to the floor in an airport. He was recorded yelling, “You’re treating me like a Black person.” 

As one person aptly put it, “Entitlement is being able to commit a felony and cry about not being able to fly home. Oppression is being murdered by the police while sleeping.”

The MAGA mob last week enjoyed white privilege. They were given the benefit of the doubt as they stormed the Capitol. “Nope, you can’t go this way,” a few officers calmly told the rioters as though they were merely directing traffic. They were committing an act of terrorism while being treated like tourists. 

The prolific recording of their own crimes doesn’t just testify to their idiocy; it testifies to their white privilege. They truly thought they’d be immune to punishment. One woman Instagrammed herself drinking champagne on the hotel balcony that night. Her post read, “After storming the capital [sic] a good glass of champagne is needed!"

If anything, I hope that this makes us just a little empathetic to the racial riots last summer. It’s not to condone them; it’s to understand the mindset. Both were breaking the law thinking that they were doing something that would further their cause for justice. Only those in the Black community did it because of police oppression; those in the MAGA community did it because they lost a democratic election. 

The actions of these insurrectionists also testify to the fact that they were emboldened by their Commander-in-Chief, soldiers in the MAGA army. They thought he would have their back. He promised he was going to march to the Capitol with them, and then he ducked out to watch the mayhem unfold on TV. Sources inside the White House reported that the President was watching the crisis in the West Wing “buoyed that his supporters were fighting so hard on his behalf.” This is a far different tune than the outrage Trump displayed of the Black community protesting against racial injustice. “When the looting starts, the shooting starts,” he said.

In the aftermath, White House staffers have reported that they have had job offers disappear as the Capitol rioters have been terminated from their jobs by their employers. They seem incensed and confused. 

The events of January 6th was like projecting an enormous black light on the stains of America’s problem of systemic racism. This election fraud claim has always been about one thing - disenfranchising minority voters and urban populations. The aims to throw out votes weren’t focused on the rural counties of Georgia, Pennsylvania, Arizona, and Michigan. No one questioned the white community’s vote. They targeted the predominantly minority population centers - Atlanta, Philadelphia, Phoenix, and Detroit. 

The Confederate flag flying in the Capitol for what historians believe was the first time in our Nation’s history is telling of this entire movement. It was racism masked in politics, election fraud, and Republicanism. And now that this movement has shown its true colors, it’s proponents are finding themselves unemployable and unable to fly.

At least they can take heart knowing that they’re not being kicked off planes and fired for the color of their skin but rather for the content of their character. 
#noflylists #Noflylist #CapitolRiots #CapitolHill #MAGATEARS

Message: US CAPITOL INVASION AND MATTERS ARISING - by Peres Sawacha - Diyerin So many times , I havel asked if BLOCKING roads during protests is PEACEFUL. That salient question has been evaded by those who should answer it for reasons best known to them. But that is that! Chinua Achebe once said "Those who have had their kernels cracked for them by benevolent spirits should in turn, learn to be humble" Simply sum up #CapitolRiots this way: Do not mock a pain that you haven't endured. Nigerians can relate. So let's have a few conversation around this. Yoruba adage says if a compound is calm, it may just be because the bastard among them is still a toddler. How did this #CapitolRiots start? That same Trumpet Trump started it by saying TAKE IT BACK, just like your slang in Nigeria🤣 So here is it: It was simply a PEACEFUL PROTEST, a FUNDAMENTAL RIGHT of Americans as ENSHRINED in American Constitution. So why did CNN and other media outfit change the name of protesters to DOMESTIC TERRORISTS? What's the offence of Trump that they blocked him on Social Media?😳 "All Animals are equal but some are more equal than others"....George Orwell Let's start from here. For America and Americans, ALL PROTEST in Africa is ACCEPTABLE and LEGITIMATE. For CNN , Twitter and Facebook etc, once you see any PROTEST in Africa, it must never be stopped! Just check the difference in approach. Jack the owner of Twitter opened his platform for donation to support insurrection in Nigeria. CNN made their platform available for ANYONE who could add petrol to fire in Nigeria during #EndSARS protest. You see, all animals are not equal? To them, Africa is just a conquered territory since they have a lot of #SlavesByChoice individuals to use. During any protest in Africa, who are the ones they VERIFY? Those who can add more inciting statements. Who are the ones to interview? Those who can incite the people further! Till this day , CNNi will not call what happened in Lagos a TERRORIST ATTACK. Roads were blocked, Lagos-Ibadan Expressway blocked for days, Some couldn't drop children in their Schools. Police and Police Stations burnt because of #EndSARS . Define INSURRECTION? Let us to be known that there's nothing they did out of the ordinary by entering the #CapitolBuilding on that day. People took #EndSARS protest to the Nigeria National Assembly, it was well accepted as their FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS by CNN and the International media. Any difference? When the Military stopped #EndSARS protesters at the National Assembly in Abuja, it was called absurdity. When the National Guard was delayed at the #CapitolBuilding because Trump was not in his right mind, CNN and Americans were calling that FAILURE🤣🤣 Tell me what the Protesters at the #CapitolHill did that was not done 100 fold in Nigeria DEMOCRACY? People literally went to block Airport in Nigeria and was well supported by International Media from USA as a legit process. CNN’s Stephanie Busari supported the insurrection. So the protesters went to #CapitolBuilding just like protesters went to the National Assembly here. Did they stop them on time in Nigeria? YES. Did they stop them on time in your saner clime? NO. What was the outcome? DEATH, CURFEW! CNN began to call US protesters TERRORISTS🤣 National Security Supersede Human Rights. Check it from the day of #CapitolRiots, argue all you like, one thing became very clear again, the West will never negotiate their National Security on the altar of Human right. Four people died but no CONDEMNATION from CNN and others. Your rights to say what you like was SUSPENDED in America IMMEDIATELY. Donald Trump was BLOCKED from all Social Media from making any inciting statement further. Not a single media in the USA including CNN dared promote any INCITING statement in support of the protest. WHY? Why did Twitter restricting any account that could incite USA any further, yet SUPPORTED everyone that incited terrorist attack that happened in Lagos last year October? Why is CNN BBCWorld and others only bringing those who condemned #CapitolRiots yet supported riot in Nigeria? Did you not noticed that nobody was discussing the death of those 4 Americans who carried no gun during protest yet killed? Did anyone ask "Who gave the order" for the National Guard to be deployed even when it wasn't Trump? Anyone discuss LIVE rounds used? NATIONAL SECURITY FIRST! Are you aware that those who protested PEACEFULLY were sacked by their employers the next day and there was No HASHTAG? Are you aware that FBI is already arresting those involved in #CapitolRiots and no objection? Are you aware that those who led protest in Nigeria are part of LagosSarsPanel? Why shouldn't there be a worldwide condemnation that those involved in #CapitolRiots must not be arrested, intimidated or sacked by their employers? Didn't confused souls like ALICIA KEYS Kerry Washington and Stephanie BUSARI and their likes raised objection to such in Nigeria? MAD o! Constituted Authority & (truncated)

Message: Ah, drumpies. One of yours. EDIT: I "shared" this a couple of hours ago and since then a number of members of this group have pointed out that this is an unsubstantiated rumour. I did a fact check on it (it only took a couple of minutes and involves a bit of critical thinking, you drumpies should try it some time) and found that this is 99% likely a false story. Like so many such false stories, there is a seed of truth to it. One, this individual apparently did die of a heart attack and, two, he definitely was an asshole. However, he did not taser his balls bringing on the heart attack. Normally I would delete something this after having shared it. Normally I would have done a fact check before sharing it, but it was early this morning and I hadn't had my coffee yet. I'm going to leave it up, though, because people with essential critical thinking skills called me out on this and my own follow up revealed that it was fake news ... real fake news aka rumour and innuendo posing as legitimate. So Drumpies ... checking the shit you post is not that hard. When others call you out on such things, take it as a clue that you need to get into the background of what you have shared. A simple google search and checking the sources of the information that you find is easy. Anyone can do it, even with limited literacy.

Message: DC UPDATES: 4 dead, 52 arrested, 14 police officers injured after pro-Trump rioters breach US Capitol; FBI opens investigation. D.C. Police Chief Robert Contee said the chaotic day included four fatalities: a woman who was shot by the U.S. Capitol Police, as well as three others — two men and one woman — who died in “separate medical emergencies.” Police had made "in excess of 52 arrests," including 26 on U.S. Capitol grounds, he said. At least 14 Metropolitan Police Department Officers were injured during the demonstrations, Contee said. Two pipe bombs — one from the DNC and one from the RNC — were also recovered by police, he said. The FBI started an investigation, seeking the public's help to identify unlawful individuals. The agency's Washington field office launched an online form for "information related to violent activity at the U.S Capitol Building." "Our goal is to preserve the public’s constitutional right to protest by protecting everyone from violence and other criminal activity," the FBI said. #violence #capitolriots #investigation #capitolhill

Message: https://www.axios.com/capitol-police-chief-national-guard-dd829363-c05f-4fa6-af31-383e613990fa.html #CapitolRiots WHY WERE CALLS FOR HELP TO THE CAPITOL DENIED?? #StevenSund #Emergency Outgoing Capitol Police chief Steven Sund said efforts to deploy the National Guard over last Wednesday's riots were hampered by the Pentagon and House and Senate security officials, according to an interview with [the Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/sund-riot-national-guard/2021/01/10/fc2ce7d4-5384-11eb-a817-e5e7f8a406d6_story.html) published late Sunday. **Why it matters: **Sund, [who resigned](https://www.axios.com/capitol-police-chief-resigns-steven-sund-75bc3e7e-cd5f-4c5d-b34e-05dc05fc2846.html) over the violence, told WashPost his requests for Guard help were "rejected or delayed" six times in total — including before the Capitol Hill protest and ensuing violence began. * Sund said he's concerned that if officials "don't get their act together with physical security, it's going to happen again" — possibly at President-elect Joe Biden's Jan. 20 inauguration. **Of note: **Lt. Gen. [Walter Piatt](https://thehill.com/person/walter-piatt), the director of the Army Staff, disputed Sund's account in a statement Monday, saying "as soon as" Capitol Police made the request to Army Secretary Ryan McCarthy for the National Guard, "he ran to the Acting Secretary of Defense's office to request approval." **Between the lines: **Sund said House Sergeant-at-Arms Paul Irving expressed discomfort over the "optics" of declaring an emergency before the protests.
Link Text: Outgoing Capitol Police chief says pleas for National Guard were repeatedly denied
Description: He told WashPost he's concerned "it's going to happen again," possibly at Biden's inauguration.

Message: Two Black U.S. Capitol police officers, who asked to remain anonymous, said they endured racist remarks from pro-Donald Trump supporters during last week's failed insurrection attempt. After hours of fighting off the pro-Trump rioters, the older of the two officers said he broke down in tears in the Capitol rotunda. He yelled out, "I got called a n----- 15 times today," and told those around him: "Trump did this and we got all of these f---ing people in our department that voted for him. How the f--- can you support him?" Some of the most harrowing images of the day included pro-Trump supporters carrying Confederate flags, including one inside the U.S. Capitol building. Other images included a video of a lone Black officer holding off a crowd of mostly white rioters and redirecting them away from the entrance to the Senate floor, where lawmakers were reportedly still inside. One of the officers who spoke with BuzzFeed added that he felt most hurt over a widely shared video on social media showing a white colleague taking a selfie with the pro-Trump rioters. "That one hurt me the most because I was on the other side of the Capitol getting my ass kicked," the officer told the outlet, adding, "If you're going to treat a group of demonstrators for Black Lives Matters one way, then you should treat this group the same god---- way." #blackofficers #capitolhill #capitolriots #capitolpolice
Link Text: Black Officers Say They Endured Racial Slurs During Violent Riots at U.S. Capitol
Description: Two Black U.S. Capitol police officers told BuzzFeed they were called racial slurs amid the Jan. 6 pro-Donald Trump riot

Message: At least 90 ARRESTS SO FAR — Over the weekend, the FBI and U.S. Justice Department continued working to identify those involved in organizing and carrying out the January 6 storming of the U.S. Capitol using images and videos from the day. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ So far, they've reportedly arrested at least 90 people, including: — A couple well-known QAnon conspiracy theorists (like Jake Angeli, pictured here in a fur-and-horned headdress carrying an American flag attached to a spear), — The man seen carrying House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s podium, — Two men seen carrying zip-tie-style restraints around the Capitol, — And more ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ “My office, along with our law enforcement partners at all levels, have been expeditiously working and leveraging every resource to identify, arrest and begin prosecuting these individuals who took part in the brazen criminal acts at the U.S. Capitol,” Michael Sherwin, the top federal prosecutor in Washington, said in a statement. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ #TheNewsWorthy #mondaynews #dailynews #weekendupdate #newsupdate #newsupdates #uscapitol #capitolriots #latestnews

Message: The Donald Trump Channel has been suspended from Youtube, adding the streaming platform to the long list of social media sites to ban the outgoing president. The outgoing president was nonchalant about the prospect of impeachment, instead choosing to focus on 450 miles of border wall in southern Texas that he declared "complete". Message: https://gizmodo.com/parler-users-breached-deep-inside-u-s-capitol-building-1846042905 #Parler #CapitolRiots At least several users of the far-right social network Parler appear to be among the horde of rioters that managed to penetrate deep inside the U.S. Capitol building and into areas normally restricted to the public, according to GPS metadata linked to videos posted to the platform the day of the insurrection in Washington. The data, [obtained](https://gizmodo.com/every-deleted-parler-post-many-with-users-location-dat-1846032466) by a computer hacker through legal means ahead of Parler’s shutdown on Monday, offers a bird’s eye view of its users swarming the Capitol grounds after receiving encouragement from President Trump — and during a violent breach that sent lawmakers and Capitol Hill visitors scrambling amid gunshots and calls for their death. GPS coordinates taken from 618 Parler videos analyzed by Gizmodo has already been sought after by FBI as part of a sweeping nationwide search for potential suspects, at least 20 of whom are already in custody. The siege on January 6, which lasted approximately two hours, resulted in five deaths, including that of a Capitol police officer whom authorities say was bludgeoned with a fire extinguisher and later succumbed to his injuries. Windows were smashed, tables overturned, and graffiti scrawled and scratched into the walls of the 220-year-old building—some calling for the murders of journalists sheltering in place nearby.
Link Text: Parler Users Breached Deep Inside U.S. Capitol Building, GPS Data Shows

Message: https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/08/politics/us-capitol-riots-arrest-pelosi-desk/index.html #Insurrection #TrumpSupporters #CapitolRiots #Violence #Lockthemup #Terrorists Feds say police found a pickup truck full of bombs and guns near Capitol insurrection as wide-ranging investigation unfurls. **Washington (CNN)**An Alabama man allegedly parked a pickup truck packed with 11 homemade bombs, an assault rifle and a handgun two blocks from the US Capitol building on Wednesday for hours before authorities ever noticed, according to federal prosecutors. Another man allegedly showed up in the nation's capital with an assault rifle and hundreds of rounds of ammunition and told acquaintances that he wanted to shoot or run over House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, prosecutors said. The revelations are some of the most unsettling details federal prosecutors have made public this week as they detail the extent of the arsenal available to aid pro-Trump rioters who stormed the Capitol. Other individuals have been accused of taking guns and ammunition onto Capitol grounds and more charges are expected to come as a wide-ranging investigation unfurls. The details about the weapons cache in the pickup truck were contained in federal documents charging Lonnie Leroy Coffman of Falkville, Alabama, with federal offenses. A bomb squad detected the arsenal during the scramble to secure the federal complex after it was overrun by pro-Trump rioters and other bombs around Washington, D.C., were found.

Message: As Democrats in the House of Representatives on Friday prepared to impeach U.S. President Donald Trump again; if he does not step down, their leader Nancy Pelosi spoke to the top U.S. general about preventing an “unhinged” Trump from accessing nuclear launch codes in the final days of his term. The extraordinary developments came two days after Trump exhorted thousands of supporters to march on the U.S. Capitol; prompting a chaotic scene in which crowds breached the building, sent lawmakers into hiding; and left a police officer and four others dead in their wake. “The situation of this unhinged President could not be more dangerous,” Pelosi said in a statement; just before a conference call with fellow Democrats to discuss whether to impeach Trump. “If the President does not leave office imminently; and willingly, the Congress will proceed with our action.” Pelosi told members she had gotten assurances from Army General Mark Milley, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff; that there are safeguards in place in the event Trump tried to launch a nuclear weapon, according to a source who was listening to the call. While U.S. presidents have access to the codes needed to fire nuclear weapons 24 hours a day, no top military; or national security official has expressed any concern publicly about Trump’s mental state with regard to nuclear weapons. Milley’s office said that Pelosi had initiated the call; and that the general “answered her questions regarding the process of nuclear command authority.” . . #CapitolHill #CapitolRiots #DonaldTrump #America #Worldnews #Congress #Trump #CapitolBuilding #capitollockdown

to verify what people said
or challenge his defeat.

and though he was not there with them
into the peoples house they piled

Message: Under stormningen av Capitolium i onsdags spreds en bild på när en leende Adam Christian Johnson bär bort talmannen Nancy Pelosis talarstol. Message: Massachusetts representative Ayanna Pressley had a harrowing experience of her own. As many people on Capitol grounds were rushing to evacuate buildings, Pressley’s staffers were blockading the entrance to the congresswoman’s office with furniture and water jugs, Pressley’s chief-of-staff, Sarah Groh, told the Boston Globe﻿. When Groh went looking for gas masks and panic buttons, she says she made a disturbing discovery: “Every panic button in my office had been torn out — the whole unit.” Groh did not provide further details and Pressley’s office did not respond to the Cut’s request for comment, but on Wednesday Ocasio-Cortez tweeted, “Even if one assumes this as some totally innocent oversight, how does the department responsible remove ALL the panic buttons from a highly visible member’s office and NOT inform that member or their staff?” #DomesticTerrorists #NoFlyList #TerroristTears #TrumpInsurrection #CapitolRiots #FBIHunt #January6th

Message: Copied from Jennifer Fisher’s post in Postcards for America, Fascinating times, eh? In case you find yourself in conversations about the incidents yesterday, here’s some info... Capitol Police are under Congressional authority; they take orders from McConnell DC Protective Services (PSD) under Mayor of DC. 100 of them. Under ultimate command of POTUS are: DC Police (MPD via DHS), DC National Guard, FBI Police & all Fed law enforcement #CapitolRiots https://twitter.com/postcards4usa/status/1347209917728399361 Further Info: -Capitol Police: The only full-service federal law enforcement agency responsible to the legislative branch of the Federal Government of the United States. answer to Mitch McConnell, as Majority Leader. There are about 2,200 of them. -The National Guard in DC is under the command of POTUS - not the Governor like in States - because DC is not a State. (Word I that the intitial reluctance of DOD to call out the DC guard was because they would come under the command of POTUS, which would obviously be a problem.) -DC Police, the Metropolitan Police Department (MPD), operate under federal authority. They have about 3,800 officers. (A unique role in that it serves as a local police department, with county, state and Federal responsibilities, and is under a municipal government but operates under Federal authority.) -United States Park Police, which provides law enforcement for the National Mall and all other National Park Service properties. The Park Police is an operation of the National Park Service, which is an agency of the Department of the Interior. -The United States Marshals Service, which acts as the city's sheriff, is under the authority of the Department of Justice *The MPD ultimately remains the primary agency in the city and has the authority to investigate all crimes in the city regardless of the location it took place.

Message: VIDEO: A West Virginia lawmaker, Republican Del. Derrick Evans, recorded a video of himself and fellow supporters of President Donald Trump storming the U.S. Capitol yesterday, prompting calls for his resignation. The video was later deleted from his social media page. Lawmakers from other states also traveled to the nation’s capital yesterday to protest the results of the Electoral College. In West Virginia, Democratic party leaders said Evans should resign and “be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.” About 10,000 people signed an online petition calling for him to be removed from office. The speaker of the state House of Delegates, Roger Hanshaw, a Republican, said Evans will need to “answer to his constituents and colleagues regarding his involvement in what has occurred today.” A House spokesman, Jared Hunt, told The Associated Press that Hanshaw is “gathering as much information as possible about what has happened and will evaluate all the potential consequences once the totality of the situation is understood.” Democratic House Minority Leader Doug Skaff called on Hanshaw to suspend Evans' access to the Statehouse and launch an investigation. #stormed #capitolhill #delegate #resignation #capitolriots

Message: https://www.commondreams.org/news/2021/01/13/watch-live-us-house-debates-historic-second-impeachment-donald-j-trump?utm_campaign=echobox&utm_medium=Social&utm_source=Twitter#Echobox=1610565017 #ImpeachtheMF #CapitolRiots "Not one moment longer," said Rep. Jerrold Nadler. "The danger is too great. We must impeach." With Republicans largely arguing that the process to seek accountability led by Democrats is somehow both "divisive" and "dangerous," members of the U.S. House on Wednesday debated an [article of impeachment](https://cicilline.house.gov/sites/cicilline.house.gov/files/documents/ARTICLES%20-%20Final%201030%20-%20011121.pdf) (pdf) against President Donald Trump for his alleged incitement to violence of an armed right-wing mob that overran the U.S. Capitol building last week. If the House votes to impeach, as is expected, Trump would be the first president in U.S. history to be impeached twice during a single term in office. In his comments from the floor during the debate, Rep. Jerrold Nadler (D-N.Y.), chair of the House Judiciary Committee, said that in both "word and deed" Trump has shown he "poses a continuing threat to our nation, to the integrity of our elections, and to our democratic order" and said "he must not remain in power one moment longer." "Not one moment longer," Nadler said. "The danger is too great. We must impeach."

Message: Capitol riots – One woman was fatally shot by police and three people died of apparent medical emergencies when a mob of President Trump’s supporters stormed the US Capitol. The four people died during a stunning attack at the heart of American democracy as members of the mob vandalised the building and assaulted police officers. At least 14 DC Metropolitan Police officers were injured; including one who was hospitalised after suffering serious injuries when he was pulled into a crowd and assaulted, Police Chief Robert Contee said. One officer had significant facial injuries from being struck by a projectile; and another officer was hospitalised after being pepper-sprayed. Metro Police made 80 arrests related to unrest this week in downtown DC, including 68 arrests on Wednesday night; according to a mayor’s spokeswoman. Dear Senator Grassley, I am an Iowan constituent, a University of Iowa employee, and a mother of three young children.  I am writing to thank you for publicly condemning the egregious behavior seen at the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday, and to implore you to align your actions going forward with your statements of dissent.  Republicans and Democrats alike are concerned for the safety and security of our democracy and our nation, and for the precedent that the response to the attacks on the Capitol have now set.  The fact that President Trump has been allowed to remain in office after inciting the deadly violence that occurred on Wednesday is unspeakably absurd and outrageous. It easily qualifies as "wrongdoing within federal agencies," which warrants whistleblower communication.  And it was in broad daylight, captured on video, and on display for the entire world to see and respond to. Message: A Poignant Profound Message For All - Where “United” takes back its full meaning in “States” - One Nation Stepping Positively into the Future: “Democracy is like a sword, the more its tempered with the stronger it becomes”- Arnold Schwarzenegger Though as surreal as it may seem a Strong, Solid Speech - just as his Muscles & Conan Sword are - on safeguarding democracy in USA that is worth the time watching and sharing. For seriously none would have ever thought that Arnold, who had thwarted a coup attempt & restored democracy in reel life as a Retd American Colonel in a dictatorial South American country in the movie Commando, will one day have to talk against a real life coup d'état on the Capitol of USA which is considered the heartland, pillar and showcase of representative democratic values to the world. However Respectful Thanks to him and many others who are standing up and lending their voice irrespective of political party affiliations or voting preference - in favor of representative democracy, its values and an individual's responsibility to uphold the very Constitution that espouses it. For as the late congressman John Lewis said “Democracy is not a state. It is an act, and each generation must do its part…” So lets make sure we do our part in upholding the democratic norms and its values because as Arnold says in his message - it cannot be taken for granted and needs conscientious action of collective responsibility immaterial of our political ideology - for remember that together we stand...divided we fall. Also on a personal note would say lets us all take a moment to thank Arnold for all that he had done for USA and its democracy. I am sure I will not be wrong in saying that he as an immigrant with a dream who came to America achieved his dream and has given back by spending his own money for many social causes and done more for USA than any born citizen their who say they will make America Great Again just by uttering rehtorics. As MSNBC host Joe Scarborough, who wrote: "I've often found that immigrants better appreciate the greatness of America than many born here. This@Schwarzenegger message proves that again." Many others have also praised Schwarzenegger's sobering message condemning the violence that can be read at https://www.newsweek.com/arnold-schwarzeneggar-praised.... Further on a side note it is vital to note that Schwarzenegger though a republican had openly declared that he will not vote for Trump and has been vocal in his criticism on many of the policies implemented by Trump’s administration and the republican party in general on climate change, Paris accord, gerrymandering, etc . Just highlighting this fact because I see many commenting in social media asking why Arnold never spoke out before and for the fact below is the statement when Arnold had made it clear that he will not vote for Trump during the 2016 general election, in a written statement released to the press then. “But as proud as I am to label myself a Republican, there is one label that I hold above all else – American. So I want to take a moment today to remind my fellow Republicans that it is not only acceptable to choose your country over your party – it is your duty.” https://fb.watch/2-t64cURBn/ https://fb.watch/2XNfzAQPj5/ #democracy #justice #accountability #DemocracyNow #senate #assembly #Congress #CapitolRiots #impeachment #Biden #BidenHarris2020 #BernieSanders #AlexandriaOcasioCortez #arnoldschwarzenegger #RoKhanna #politics #humanrights #law #history #societyandculture #legacy #scotus #society #sociology #historymatters #government #ethics #politicsandlaw #gop #houseofrepresentatives #DemocracyNow #CapitolRiots #BidenHarris2020 #democracy #DemocracyIsNotASpectatorSport

Message: US CAPITOL INVASION AND MATTERS ARISING - by Peres Sawacha - Diyerin So many times , I havel asked if BLOCKING roads during protests is PEACEFUL. That salient question has been evaded by those who should answer it for reasons best known to them. But that is that! Chinua Achebe once said "Those who have had their kernels cracked for them by benevolent spirits should in turn, learn to be humble" Simply sum up #CapitolRiots this way: Do not mock a pain that you haven't endured. Nigerians can relate. So let's have a few conversation around this. Yoruba adage says if a compound is calm, it may just be because the bastard among them is still a toddler. How did this #CapitolRiots start? That same Trumpet Trump started it by saying TAKE IT BACK, just like your slang in Nigeria🤣 So here is it: It was simply a PEACEFUL PROTEST, a FUNDAMENTAL RIGHT of Americans as ENSHRINED in American Constitution. So why did CNN and other media outfit change the name of protesters to DOMESTIC TERRORISTS? What's the offence of Trump that they blocked him on Social Media?😳 "All Animals are equal but some are more equal than others"....George Orwell Let's start from here. For America and Americans, ALL PROTEST in Africa is ACCEPTABLE and LEGITIMATE. For CNN , Twitter and Facebook etc, once you see any PROTEST in Africa, it must never be stopped! Just check the difference in approach. Jack the owner of Twitter opened his platform for donation to support insurrection in Nigeria. CNN made their platform available for ANYONE who could add petrol to fire in Nigeria during #EndSARS protest. You see, all animals are not equal? To them, Africa is just a conquered territory since they have a lot of #SlavesByChoice individuals to use. During any protest in Africa, who are the ones they VERIFY? Those who can add more inciting statements. Who are the ones to interview? Those who can incite the people further! Till this day , CNNi will not call what happened in Lagos a TERRORIST ATTACK. Roads were blocked, Lagos-Ibadan Expressway blocked for days, Some couldn't drop children in their Schools. Police and Police Stations burnt because of #EndSARS . Define INSURRECTION? Let us to be known that there's nothing they did out of the ordinary by entering the #CapitolBuilding on that day. People took #EndSARS protest to the Nigeria National Assembly, it was well accepted as their FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS by CNN and the International media. Any difference? When the Military stopped #EndSARS protesters at the National Assembly in Abuja, it was called absurdity. When the National Guard was delayed at the #CapitolBuilding because Trump was not in his right mind, CNN and Americans were calling that FAILURE🤣🤣 Tell me what the Protesters at the #CapitolHill did that was not done 100 fold in Nigeria DEMOCRACY? People literally went to block Airport in Nigeria and was well supported by International Media from USA as a legit process. CNN’s Stephanie Busari supported the insurrection. So the protesters went to #CapitolBuilding just like protesters went to the National Assembly here. Did they stop them on time in Nigeria? YES. Did they stop them on time in your saner clime? NO. What was the outcome? DEATH, CURFEW! CNN began to call US protesters TERRORISTS🤣 National Security Supersede Human Rights. Check it from the day of #CapitolRiots, argue all you like, one thing became very clear again, the West will never negotiate their National Security on the altar of Human right. Four people died but no CONDEMNATION from CNN and others. Your rights to say what you like was SUSPENDED in America IMMEDIATELY. Donald Trump was BLOCKED from all Social Media from making any inciting statement further. Not a single media in the USA including CNN dared promote any INCITING statement in support of the protest. WHY? Why did Twitter restricting any account that could incite USA any further, yet SUPPORTED everyone that incited terrorist attack that happened in Lagos last year October? Why is CNN BBCWorld and others only bringing those who condemned #CapitolRiots yet supported riot in Nigeria? Did you not noticed that nobody was discussing the death of those 4 Americans who carried no gun during protest yet killed? Did anyone ask "Who gave the order" for the National Guard to be deployed even when it wasn't Trump? Anyone discuss LIVE rounds used? NATIONAL SECURITY FIRST! Are you aware that those who protested PEACEFULLY were sacked by their employers the next day and there was No HASHTAG? Are you aware that FBI is already arresting those involved in #CapitolRiots and no objection? Are you aware that those who led protest in Nigeria are part of LagosSarsPanel? Why shouldn't there be a worldwide condemnation that those involved in #CapitolRiots must not be arrested, intimidated or sacked by their employers? Didn't confused souls like ALICIA KEYS Kerry Washington and Stephanie BUSARI and their likes raised objection to such in Nigeria? MAD o! Constituted Authority & (truncated)

Description: Two weeks from tonight, Donald Trump will no longer control our nuclear arsenal. He won’t have command of the federal agencies or even, most likely, his own Twitter account. As much as all of that may upset you, it’s nonetheless true. We can’t change it. The rest of us, however, will still be here. We’ve got nowhere to go. What is life going to be like for us on January 21st? Not many people seem to be thinking about this — up to and including the people we pay to think about it, our political leaders. Donald Trump thinks almost exclusively about Donald Trump. But so does every single Democrat in congress, as well as every Republican. All of them — every one — is Trump-obsessed. Who’s YOU-obsessed? Who’s got YOUR concerns top of mind? Who wakes up in the middle of the night worried about your family? As far as we can tell tonight, no one. That’s the main thing we need to change.

Message: https://www.wusa9.com/article/news/national/capitol-riots/fbi-pipe-bombs-person-wanted-wasington-dc-us-capitol/65-5d4f4e85-ff26-4493-a93b-1c127687a138 HELP THE FBI FIND THIS GUY. SHARE> #CapitolRiots **The still picture from a video camera shows a man wearing a gray hoodie, jeans and a mask, carrying a suspicious bag.** WASHINGTON — The FBI wants information on a masked, hooded person spotted by video cameras possibly placing, on the ground, one of the two pipe bombs found in the streets of Washington, D.C. on Wednesday amid the chaos at the U.S. Capitol Building. The still picture from a video camera shows a person wearing a gray hoodie, jeans and a mask, carrying a suspicious black bag. On Monday, January 11, the FBI tweeted more detailed photos from the surveillance photo, showing the suspect's sneakers and the backpack the suspect was carrying. If you have any information concerning this incident, please contact the FBI's toll-free tip line at 1-800-CALL-FBI (1-800-225-5324), or submit tips online at [http://fbi.gov/USCapitol](http://fbi.gov/USCapitol), said the FBI in its tweet on Thursday. There is now a $50,000 reward for information in this case.

Message: Your daily #5fastfacts Number 1: Capitol Riot Fallout - The FBI warned that "armed protests" are being planned at all 50 state capitols and the U.S. Capitol over the next 8 days in the lead up to President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration. - Two U.S. Capitol police officers have been suspended and at least 10 others are being investigated for their behavior during last week’s riot. - House Democrats plan first to vote this evening on a resolution urging VP Mike Pence to invoke the 25th Amendment Number 2: Corporate America Reacts to the Riots Major companies like Google, Coca-Cola and UPS have all pledged to suspend political contributions across the board. Other companies are focusing on lawmakers they believe were complicit in Trump's effort to disrupt the affirmation of Biden's election victory. Axios reports "CEOs became 4th branch of government": CEOs managed to act as a faster and more effective check on the power of the president than Congress could. They have money, they have power, and they have more of the public's trust than politicians do. And they're using all of it to try to preserve America's system of governance. Number 3: Coronavirus The World Health Organization warned that herd immunity will not happen in 2021. That means they believe social distancing measures will need to stay in place "for the rest of this year," even as the vaccine rollout continues. In the US, there have been more than 200,000 coronavirus cases every single day for a week. Number 4: Federal Executions The federal government has executed 10 people in the past 6 months after a 17-year hiatus. Lisa Montgomery, the only woman on federal death row, was scheduled to be executed today for murdering a 23-year-old woman and kidnapping her fetus in 2004. A federal judge halted the execution of Lisa Montgomery hours before she was scheduled to die and is now subject to a competency hearing. Number 5: Covid in the Capitol Three Democratic Congressmembers have tested positive for Covid-19. Rep. Pramila Jayapal (Wash.), Rep. Brad Schneider, (Ill.) and Rep. Bonnie Watson Coleman (N.J.) think they got the virus while locked down during the capitol riots with maskless Republicans. In a statement, Rep. Jayapal said this created a "superspreader event on top of a domestic terrorist attack." Jayapal: "[S]everal Republicans not only cruelly refused to wear a mask but mocked colleagues and staff who offered them one." #capitolriots #corporateamerica #coronavirus #deathrow #lisamontgomery #covid #capitol

Message: A Strong, Solid Speech, Just As His Muscles & Sword Are: “Democracy is like a sword, the more its tempered with the stronger it becomes” -Arnold Schwarzenegger Though as surreal as it may seem a profound & poignant message indeed from the Governator on safeguarding democracy in USA that is worth the time watching and sharing. For seriously none would have ever thought that Arnold, who had thwarted a coup attempt & restored democracy in reel life as a Retd American Colonel in a dictatorial South American country in the movie Commando, will one day have to talk against a real life coup d'état on the Capitol of USA which is considered the heartland, pillar and showcase of representative democratic values to the world. However Respectful Thanks to him and many others who are standing up and lending their voice irrespective of political party affiliations or voting preference - in favor of representative democracy, its values and an individual's responsibility to uphold the very Constitution that espouses it. For as the late congressman John Lewis said “Democracy is not a state. It is an act, and each generation must do its part…” So lets make sure we do our part in upholding the democratic norms and its values because as Arnold says in his message - it cannot be taken for granted and needs conscientious action of collective responsibility immaterial of our political ideology - for remember that together we stand...divided we fall. Also lets us all take a moment to thank Arnold for all that he had done for USA and its democracy. I am sure I will not be wrong in saying that he as an immigrant with a dream who came to America achieved his dream and has given back by spending his own money for many social causes and done more for USA than any anyone born citizen their who say they will make America Great Again just by uttering rehtorics As MSNBC host Joe Scarborough, who wrote: "I've often found that immigrants better appreciate the greatness of America than many born here. This@Schwarzenegger message proves that again." Many others have also praise Schwarzenegger's sobering message condemning the violence that can be read at https://www.newsweek.com/arnold-schwarzeneggar-praised.... Also on a side note it is vital to note that Schwarzenegger though a republican had openly declared that he will not vote for Trump and has been vocal in his criticism on many of the policies implemented by Trump’s administration and the republican party in general on climate change, Paris accord, etc . Just highlighting this fact because I see many commenting in social media asking why Arnold never spoke out before and for the fact below is the statement when Arnold had made it clear that he will not vote for Trump during the 2016 general election, in a written statement released to the press then. “But as proud as I am to label myself a Republican, there is one label that I hold above all else – American. Message: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has placed digital signs at bus stops throughout Washington, DC, to ask the public for help in identifying the people who participated in the deadly insurrection at the US Capitol on Wednesday. One sign shows a reward offer of $50,000 for the identification of a person who possibly placed, on the ground, one of the two pipe bombs found in the streets of Washington, D.C., near the Capitol. The shows a person wearing a gray hoodie, jeans and a mask, carrying a suspicious black bag. If you have any information concerning either of these incidents, please contact the FBI's toll-free tip line at 1-800-CALL-FBI (1-800-225-5324), or submit tips online at http://fbi.gov/USCapitol, said the FBI in its tweet on Thursday. #FBI #suspects #wanted #capitolhill #capitolriots

Message: Jamaican Diaspora leaders expressed shock at the storming of the Capitol building. 🇯🇲🇺🇸 1. Dr Rupert Francis, head of the Diaspora Crime and Prevention Task Force and former member of the Jamaica Defence Force, described the behaviour as irresponsible, “Those who caused this should be held accountable. The president (Donald Trump) should be held accountable. There was no need to occupy Washington,” he said. “America should be ashamed to call itself the United States of America because we are not united,” he said. 2. Leroy Comie, New York State Senator, a Jamaican, said what happened in Washington was the culmination of Trump’s efforts to create chaos as he still refuses to accept his loss to Biden. “This is an unparalleled destruction of our country,” Comie said, calling for the immediate arrest of the instigators. 3. Michael King, New York Police Inspector in charge of the NYPD Special Victims Crime Unit, a Jamaican, described the situation as “terrible.” He said, “It is very discouraging to see this type of behaviour, especially in this country, to see what has descended on Capitol Hill.” 4. Una Clarke, former New York City Councilwoman also condemned the scenes that took place on Capitol Hill. “This is un-American. Never in my life I thought I would ever see this in America,” said the Jamaican. “If you cultivate a dictator, this is what you get,” she said frankly. 5. Dr Basil Wilson, former provost at the College of Criminal Justice in Manhattan, labelled the events as an insurrection. “This is appalling,” he said, adding that the incoming attorney general should conduct an investigation and people criminally charged for sedition and inciting riot. 6. Congresswoman Yvette Clarke called it an attempted coup. “Today, the Capitol was attached by an insurgent group of domestic terrorists. As a member of the House Committee on Homeland Security, I am concerned for the safety of not only my fellow elected officials, but also for the safety of our democracy,” she said. “We are in the throes of a coup because President Trump refuses to accept the will of the American people.” #jamaicandiaspora #jamaicans #jamaicanamerican #capitolhill #capitolriots

Message: US First Lady Melania Trump on Monday expressed disappointment over last Wednesday’s riots at the Capitol in Washington. . In a thank-you note she signed on Monday, the outgoing FLOTUS, who leaves the White House on January 20, condemned attacks and accusations on her person since the ugly incident occurred last week. . “I am disappointed and disheartened with what happened last week,” she wrote in the note titled, ‘First Lady Melania Trump: Our Path Forward’. . “I find it shameful that surrounding these tragic events there has been salacious gossip, unwarranted personal attacks, and false misleading accusations on me – from people who are looking to be relevant and have an agenda. This time is solely about healing our country and its citizens. It should not be used for personal gain.” . Melania implored Americans to stop the violence. “Our Nation must heal in a civil manner. Make no mistake about it, I absolutely condemn the violence that has occurred on our Nation’s Capitol. Violence is never acceptable,” she stated. . The FLOTUS thanked Americans for the privilege of service in the last four years saying, “It has been the honor of my lifetime to serve as your First Lady. I want to thank the millions of Americans who supported my husband and me over the past 4 years and shown the incredible impact of the American spirit. I am grateful to you all for letting me serve you on platforms which are dear to me. . The PUNCH had reported that supporters of outgoing President Donald Trump invaded the Capitol during a joint session of Congress held to certify the electoral victory of President-elect Joe Biden. -- -- #ogunupdate #naijaupdate #africaupdate #worldupdate #donaldtrump #melaniatrump #useelection #capitolriots

Message: AP — As the House prepares for impeachment, President Donald Trump faces a single charge — “incitement of insurrection” — over the deadly riot at the U.S. Capitol. Lawmakers are set to introduce the legislation Monday, with voting mid-week. Pelosi’s leadership team also will seek a quick vote on a resolution calling on Vice President Mike Pence & Cabinet officials to invoke the 25th Amendment. The four-page impeachment bill draws from Trump’s own false statements about his election defeat to Democrat Joe Biden; his pressure on state officials in Georgia to “find” him more votes; and his White House rally ahead of the Capitol siege, in which he encouraged thousands of supporters to “fight like hell” before they stormed the building on Wednesday. A violent & largely white mob of Trump supporters overpowered police, broke through security lines & windows & rampaged through the Capitol, forcing lawmakers to scatter as they were finalizing Biden’s victory over Trump in the Electoral College. “President Trump gravely endangered the security of the United States and its institutions of Government,” the legislation said. The bill from Reps. David Cicilline of Rhode Island, Ted Lieu of California, Jamie Raskin of Maryland and Jerrold Nadler of New York, said Trump threatened “the integrity of the democratic system, interfered with the peaceful transition of power” and “betrayed” trust. “He will remain a threat to national security, democracy, and the Constitution if allowed to remain in office,” they wrote. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says the House will proceed with legislation to impeach Trump as she pushes the vice president & the Cabinet to invoke constitutional authority to force him out, warning that Trump is a threat to democracy after the deadly assault on the Capitol. A Republican senator, Pat Toomey of Pennsylvania, joined Republican Sen. Lisa Murkowski of Alaska over the weekend in calling for Trump to “resign and go away as soon as possible.” #donaldtrump #presidenttrump #trumpimpeachment #mikepence #nancypelosi #joebiden #kamalaharris #presidenttrump #incitementofinsurrection #insurrection #sedition #capitolriots #impeachtrump #proudboys #tedcruz #riots

For seriously none would have ever thought that Arnold, who had thwarted a coup attempt & restored democracy in reel life as a Retd American Colonel in a dictatorial South American country in the movie Commando, will one day have to talk against a real life coup d'état on the Capitol of USA which is considered the heartland, pillar and showcase of representative democratic values to the world. However Respectful Thanks to him and many others who are standing up and lending their voice irrespective of political party affiliations or voting preference - in favor of representative democracy, its values and an individual's responsibility to uphold the very Constitution that espouses it. For as the late congressman John Lewis said “Democracy is not a state. It is an act, and each generation must do its part…” So lets make sure we do our part in upholding the democratic norms and its values because as Arnold says in his message - it cannot be taken for granted and needs conscientious action of collective responsibility immaterial of our political ideology - for remember that together we stand...divided we fall. Also on a personal note would say lets us all take a moment to thank Arnold for all that he had done for USA and its democracy. I am sure I will not be wrong in saying that he as an immigrant with a dream who came to America achieved his dream and has given back by spending his own money for many social causes and done more for USA than any born citizen their who say they will make America Great Again just by uttering rehtorics. Remember . . . . . if you listen to fools, 
THE MOB RULES!!!

Fools = weak government leaders

40 years since Black Sabbath released this song in 1981, it's  still just as poignant.

Message: A Poignant Profound Message For All - Where “United” takes back its full meaning in “States” - One Nation Stepping Positively into the Future: “Democracy is like a sword, the more its tempered with the stronger it becomes”- Arnold Schwarzenegger Though as surreal as it may seem a Strong, Solid Speech - just as his Muscles & Conan Sword are - on safeguarding democracy in USA that is worth the time watching and sharing. For seriously none would have ever thought that Arnold, who had thwarted a coup attempt & restored democracy in reel life as a Retd American Colonel in a dictatorial South American country in the movie Commando, will one day have to talk against a real life coup d'état on the Capitol of USA which is considered the heartland, pillar and showcase of representative democratic values to the world. However Respectful Thanks to him and many others who are standing up and lending their voice irrespective of political party affiliations or voting preference - in favor of representative democracy, its values and an individual's responsibility to uphold the very Constitution that espouses it. For as the late congressman John Lewis said “Democracy is not a state. It is an act, and each generation must do its part…” So lets make sure we do our part in upholding the democratic norms and its values because as Arnold says in his message - it cannot be taken for granted and needs conscientious action of collective responsibility immaterial of our political ideology - for remember that together we stand...divided we fall. Also on a personal note would say lets us all take a moment to thank Arnold for all that he had done for USA and its democracy. I am sure I will not be wrong in saying that he as an immigrant with a dream who came to America achieved his dream and has given back by spending his own money for many social causes and done more for USA than any born citizen their who say they will make America Great Again just by uttering rehtorics. As MSNBC host Joe Scarborough, who wrote: "I've often found that immigrants better appreciate the greatness of America than many born here. This@Schwarzenegger message proves that again." Many others have also praised Schwarzenegger's sobering message condemning the violence that can be read at https://www.newsweek.com/arnold-schwarzeneggar-praised.... Further on a side note it is vital to note that Schwarzenegger though a republican had openly declared that he will not vote for Trump and has been vocal in his criticism on many of the policies implemented by Trump’s administration and the republican party in general on climate change, Paris accord, gerrymandering, etc . Just highlighting this fact because I see many commenting in social media asking why Arnold never spoke out before and for the fact below is the statement when Arnold had made it clear that he will not vote for Trump during the 2016 general election, in a written statement released to the press then. “But as proud as I am to label myself a Republican, there is one label that I hold above all else – American. So I want to take a moment today to remind my fellow Republicans that it is not only acceptable to choose your country over your party – it is your duty.” https://fb.watch/2-t64cURBn/ https://fb.watch/2XNfzAQPj5/ #democracy #justice #accountability #DemocracyNow #senate #assembly #Congress #CapitolRiots #impeachment #Biden #BidenHarris2020 #BernieSanders #AlexandriaOcasioCortez #arnoldschwarzenegger #RoKhanna #politics #humanrights #law #history #societyandculture #legacy #scotus #society #sociology #historymatters #government #ethics #politicsandlaw #gop #houseofrepresentatives #DemocracyNow #CapitolRiots #BidenHarris2020 #democracy #DemocracyIsNotASpectatorSport
